page.title: 11VENTNOR'S NEWSPAPER.
page.content: The name of Ventnor's local newspaper is the Mercury, called after the messenger of the gods. It is the oldest newspaper on the Island and was first printed in 1853 at 33 Pier Street on the site of the Old Mill. Recently it has changed hands and moved to the High Street. It originally cost one penny but it now costs 10p. It is a tabloid paper and has 8 pages. The Mercury is published once a week on a Thursday. Two people produce the paper and it has a circulation of 3,000 copies. It is distributed by car to local newsagents. It takes about 8 hours to print but much longer to set up. The paper consists of reports of local events, letters, announcements and advertisements.
